author: wsjcom
title: If Oregon’s So Free, Where Is the Opposition?
text:
Regarding your editorial “The Free Speech States” (March 26): Oregon’s politics are totally dominated by education and public-employee union closed-shop dues that support Democratic Party campaigns over 98% of the time. Hence, Democratic governors for 30 straight years, with all agency heads, managers, state board and committee appointments are all almost exclusively Democrats. There is likely to be a Democratic supermajority in the state legislature in November. The state hires nationally, but, oddly, only hires Democrats.
There’s...
